Entries.default: A large aumaua sailor sits on the docks, broad shoulders hunched forward, back bowed. When he shifts, his blue-green skin ripples over his hulking muscles.
"Have a pity and toss me a pire, will you?"
"Stage is this way, ain't it?"
"Got nerves twisting in my belly like coldwater eels."
"I did it! I remembered my lines!"
"Watch where you step. I sure can't."
"Ain't no crew will hire me. What good's a pirate who can't see? Forget navigating by the stars or shooting a pistol - I can't even swing a sword accurately now."
"How would you feel about playing the part of Eothas on stage?"
"What's your story?"
"Here you go."
"Farewell."
"What? I'm no actor, and besides, I can't barely see nothing as it is."
"You're an idiot. Stay here and die of hunger."
"It pays. Do you want a job or not?"
"Well, there's no need to be rude about it. Just cause I'm a burly sort... and a killer and a thief... don't mean my feelings never get hurt."
"That I do, mate. Long as there's coin to be had, I'm up for trying anything." With a grunt, he pops his over-muscled neck.
"Turn me in the right direction, and I'll make my way to the Radiant Court."
"Is that what my life boils down to? A moment of entertainment for others?" He sighs heavily, big shoulders hunched.
"Ondra's blessings to you for sharing, sailor."
"I thank you for your kindness - and your endless pockets. The charity's much appreciated." He nods gratefully, biting the coin to test it's metal grade.
"You'll just need to speak a few lines, stand there, and look intimidating."
"Believe me, you're perfect for the role."
"In this troupe, being a good actor isn't a requirement."
"You really think so?" He raises his chin up, tilting his face side to side as if examining himself in a nonexistent mirror.
"Intimidating, I can do. Reciting a bunch of namby-pamby lines is going to be the trickier part. But I'm game to try."

"Easy enough. And it pays, don't it? Then count me in."

The laugh that booms from his chest sounds like rocks rattling against his ribs.

"I was a boatswain not so long ago, and a damned good one, at that. But I took a shot to the face, see?" 

He waves one massive hand in front of his sightless eyes.

"Didn't lose much skin, but the flash burned out my eyesight. I can't make out so much as a blurry shape more than a foot away - makes me right useless on a crew, now, don't it? No one'll have me for work."
"Maybe I do have a mug made for the stage. I sure got the voice for it, eh?"
He sighs as he straightens his spine, standing even taller to tower over you.
